1. Market Database with Array of Structures

This program implements a student database with name, subject marks, total, and average using an array of structures. 
#include <stdio.h>
#include <string.h>

#define MAX_STUDENTS 100
#define MAX_SUBJECTS 5

struct Student {
    char name[50];
    int marks[MAX_SUBJECTS];
    int total;
    float average;
};

struct Student database[MAX_STUDENTS];
int studentCount = 0;

void addStudent() {
    if (studentCount >= MAX_STUDENTS) {
        printf("Database full! Cannot add more students.\n");
        return;
    }
    
    struct Student *s = &database[studentCount];
    printf("Enter student name: ");
    scanf("%s", s->name);
    
    s->total = 0;
    printf("Enter marks for %d subjects: ", MAX_SUBJECTS);
    for (int i = 0; i < MAX_SUBJECTS; i++) {
        scanf("%d", &s->marks[i]);
        s->total += s->marks[i];
    }
    
    s->average = (float)s->total / MAX_SUBJECTS;
    studentCount++;
    printf("Student added successfully!\n");
}

void displayStudents() {
    if (studentCount == 0) {
        printf("No students in database.\n");
        return;
    }
    
    printf("\n%-20s", "Name");
    for (int i = 0; i < MAX_SUBJECTS; i++) {
        printf("Sub%d ", i+1);
    }
    printf("%-10s %-10s\n", "Total", "Average");
    
    for (int i = 0; i < studentCount; i++) {
        struct Student *s = &database[i];
        printf("%-20s", s->name);
        for (int j = 0; j < MAX_SUBJECTS; j++) {
            printf("%-5d", s->marks[j]);
        }
        printf("%-10d %-10.2f\n", s->total, s->average);
    }
}

void sellOut() {
    studentCount = 0;
    printf("All student records deleted!\n");
}

int main() {
    int choice;
    
    do {
        printf("\nStudent Database Menu:\n");
        printf("1. Add Student\n");
        printf("2. Display Students\n");
        printf("3. Sell Out (Delete All)\n");
        printf("4. Exit\n");
        printf("Enter your choice: ");
        scanf("%d", &choice);
        
        switch(choice) {
            case 1: addStudent(); break;
            case 2: displayStudents(); break;
            case 3: sellOut(); break;
            case 4: printf("Exiting...\n"); break;
            default: printf("Invalid choice!\n");
        }
    } while (choice != 4);
    
    return 0;
}

2. BST with Post Order Traversal

This program implements a Binary Search Tree with Post Order traversal. 
#include <stdio.h>
#include <stdlib.h>

struct Node {
    int data;
    struct Node* left;
    struct Node* right;
};

struct Node* createNode(int data) {
    struct Node* newNode = (struct Node*)malloc(sizeof(struct Node));
    newNode->data = data;
    newNode->left = NULL;
    newNode->right = NULL;
    return newNode;
}

struct Node* insert(struct Node* root, int data) {
    if (root == NULL) {
        return createNode(data);
    }
    
    if (data < root->data) {
        root->left = insert(root->left, data);
    } else if (data > root->data) {
        root->right = insert(root->right, data);
    }
    
    return root;
}

void postOrder(struct Node* root) {
    if (root != NULL) {
        postOrder(root->left);
        postOrder(root->right);
        printf("%d ", root->data);
    }
}

int main() {
    struct Node* root = NULL;
    int choice, value;
    
    do {
        printf("\nBST Post Order Menu:\n");
        printf("1. Insert Node\n");
        printf("2. Display Post Order\n");
        printf("3. Exit\n");
        printf("Enter your choice: ");
        scanf("%d", &choice);
        
        switch(choice) {
            case 1:
                printf("Enter value to insert: ");
                scanf("%d", &value);
                root = insert(root, value);
                break;
            case 2:
                printf("Post Order Traversal: ");
                postOrder(root);
                printf("\n");
                break;
            case 3:
                printf("Exiting...\n");
                break;
            default:
                printf("Invalid choice!\n");
        }
    } while (choice != 3);
    
    return 0;
}

3. BST with Invoice Material

This program implements a BST for invoice management. 
#include <stdio.h>
#include <stdlib.h>
#include <string.h>

struct Invoice {
    int invoiceNo;
    char customerName[50];
    float amount;
};

struct Node {
    struct Invoice invoice;
    struct Node* left;
    struct Node* right;
};

struct Node* createNode(int invoiceNo, char* name, float amount) {
    struct Node* newNode = (struct Node*)malloc(sizeof(struct Node));
    newNode->invoice.invoiceNo = invoiceNo;
    strcpy(newNode->invoice.customerName, name);
    newNode->invoice.amount = amount;
    newNode->left = NULL;
    newNode->right = NULL;
    return newNode;
}

struct Node* insert(struct Node* root, int invoiceNo, char* name, float amount) {
    if (root == NULL) {
        return createNode(invoiceNo, name, amount);
    }
    
    if (invoiceNo < root->invoice.invoiceNo) {
        root->left = insert(root->left, invoiceNo, name, amount);
    } else if (invoiceNo > root->invoice.invoiceNo) {
        root->right = insert(root->right, invoiceNo, name, amount);
    }
    
    return root;
}

void inOrder(struct Node* root) {
    if (root != NULL) {
        inOrder(root->left);
        printf("Invoice No: %d, Customer: %s, Amount: %.2f\n", 
               root->invoice.invoiceNo, root->invoice.customerName, root->invoice.amount);
        inOrder(root->right);
    }
}

struct Node* search(struct Node* root, int invoiceNo) {
    if (root == NULL || root->invoice.invoiceNo == invoiceNo) {
        return root;
    }
    
    if (invoiceNo < root->invoice.invoiceNo) {
        return search(root->left, invoiceNo);
    }
    
    return search(root->right, invoiceNo);
}

int main() {
    struct Node* root = NULL;
    int choice, invoiceNo;
    char name[50];
    float amount;
    
    do {
        printf("\nInvoice BST Menu:\n");
        printf("1. Add Invoice\n");
        printf("2. Display All Invoices\n");
        printf("3. Search Invoice\n");
        printf("4. Exit\n");
        printf("Enter your choice: ");
        scanf("%d", &choice);
        
        switch(choice) {
            case 1:
                printf("Enter Invoice No: ");
                scanf("%d", &invoiceNo);
                printf("Enter Customer Name: ");
                scanf("%s", name);
                printf("Enter Amount: ");
                scanf("%f", &amount);
                root = insert(root, invoiceNo, name, amount);
                break;
            case 2:
                printf("All Invoices:\n");
                inOrder(root);
                break;
            case 3:
                printf("Enter Invoice No to search: ");
                scanf("%d", &invoiceNo);
                struct Node* result = search(root, invoiceNo);
                if (result != NULL) {
                    printf("Invoice Found: No: %d, Customer: %s, Amount: %.2f\n", 
                           result->invoice.invoiceNo, result->invoice.customerName, result->invoice.amount);
                } else {
                    printf("Invoice not found!\n");
                }
                break;
            case 4:
                printf("Exiting...\n");
                break;
            default:
                printf("Invalid choice!\n");
        }
    } while (choice != 4);
    
    return 0;
}
